locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the transition from Epiphany to Lent, the meaning of the 'Lamb of God' in Exodus and Leviticus, and the current state of world sin (South Africa, Mexico).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Detailed connection between the Passover lamb (Exodus) and the sin offering (Leviticus).

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the identity of Jesus and the nature of sin, transitioning into a declaration of the substitutionary atonement in the final paragraph.
voorbeelden: The identity of Jesus has been revealed
The great High Priest has become the sacrifice

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should feel the weight of sin, the necessity of the cross, and ultimately comfort in Christ's substitution.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. Mentioned in the context of John the Baptist's vision, but less as the active agent of the current sermon event.

voorbeelden: John is the model for every preacher
There will be no fasting in the Kingdom of heaven
The identity of Jesus has been revealed to him by God
Take another look at the hymns
Let’s go back to the book of Exodus
I felt a real stab of loss
To those whose hearts bend... the promise is given
He speaks to us, to you, to me, here, today
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but concentrated almost entirely in the final 10% of the text.

voorbeelden: Christ our Passover lamb has been sacrificed
The great High Priest has become the sacrifice
declaratieven.autoriteit: High authority derived from the liturgical 'Behold' and the final 'Amen'.

indicatoren: Long explanations of Greek words and Old Testament history
Third-person reporting on South Africa and Mexico
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged but remains an observer for most of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Immediate present-tense promises earlier in the text
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final moments.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Deeply personal and direct ('to you, to me, here, today').
voorbeelden: It should have been me... but it was him.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and homiletical 'I' (I don't like Lent).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, mostly at the end.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the sacrifice of Christ to the individual hearer.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing John the Baptist, Israel, and world events.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that requires a 'bridge' to the present.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about the Lamb of God.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the history of the Lamb (Assertive) to the reality of the Cross (Declarative) to the promise for the hearer (Commissive).
voorbeelden: The great High Priest has become the sacrifice... he speaks to us, to you.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent execution of the 'Toezegging' (Promise) at the climax.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he takes away the sin... follow him.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a heavy constative start, the sermon successfully pivots into a performative event where the Word is 'done' to the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: It should have been me... but it was him.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long story about Jeffrey and Bob's Christmas tree.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon ends as a definitive encounter with the Word.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'Behold' functions as a liturgical and performative act.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, explicitly stated at the end.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, preacher as 'pointer' like John the Baptist.
tekstueel_bewijs: As God the Father spoke to John... so he speaks to us... through his living Word.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, in the context of baptism.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly, through the 'revealing' of the Word.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the 'living Word'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, the theme of Epiphany is used performatively.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'was' and 'meant' to 'is' and 'does' earlier in the text.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The blood of the sacrificed Passover lamb is the powerful sign.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, the blood of this Lamb covers your doorpost.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from historical description to present-tense application.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the current strength of the ending.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'I' in the first half.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Involve the 'You' of the congregation in the struggle of the 'worm at the core'.
voorbeeldzinnen: You know that worm eating at the core of your life.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from the 'talking about' of exegesis to the 'doing' of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending a message, but acting as a conduit for a divine declaration that changes the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the cleverness of the 'Christmas tree' story, but in the illocutionary force of the 'Behold'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's success is found in the final paragraph's shift from Assertive to Commissive/Declarative.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Behold, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows a classic homiletical 'funnel'—starting wide with human experience and narrowing to the sharp point of the Cross.
